page.title: 03LISTED FARMHOUSES
page.content: Near Wellington Heath are several listed buildings. {Burtons Farm}is a tall large black and white house built 400 years ago. The external walls between many tall vertical beams are now brick but some of the internal walls are still daub and wattle as was noticed recently when a new bathroom was built. Outside, there is a{barn constructed {by the Cruck method,}the arched beams thought to have been used in a ship. In the yard is a now ornamental{cider {press}and also a{milestone}"Gloucester 18 miles", rescued from the nearby disused Hereford-Gloucester canal. The mixed farm is run by the owner's absent son and contractors are brought in to do the ploughing and harvesting. The son-in-law is the UK director of {HACK-A-SACK,}a special non-bouncing ball used in schools for training.
